metadata.name: Global Tariff Briefing
metadata.audience: NYT colleagues tracking tariffs and trade policy globally

all.headline: Financial Products for Hedging: Masters in Business with Jeff Chang
all.description: Barry speaks with Jeff Chang, President and Co-Founder of Vest. They discuss his journey into founding Vest. They also discuss Jeff's views on the benefits of hedging along with with the growth in pop

all.headline: Iran Strikes: What’s at Stake for Oil Markets as Trump Attacks
all.description: President Donald Trump’s decision to strike Iran creates new risks for a significant chunk of the world’s oil supply.

all.headline: The Evolution of Giorgia Meloni: Her Plan for Italy and Fears of AI
all.description: The prime minister stabilized Italy. In her second act, she wants growth — and a global reality check on AI.

all.headline: James van Geelen on His Viral AI Doom Scenario
all.description: Making Sense of the 'Citrini Selloff.'

all.headline: Odd Lots: James van Geelen on His AI Doom Scenario (Podcast)

all.headline: Africa's Critical Minerals Moment | Bloomberg Next Africa
all.description: In this episode of Next Africa, we examine the intensifying global race for critical minerals and how the continent can turn surging demand into lasting economic gains. One country looking to seize th

all.headline: Deutscher Rüstungsboom
all.description: Die Aufrüstung der Bundeswehr beflügelt die deutsche Wirtschaft mehr als viele erwartet hatten. Die Investitionen könnten möglicherweise sogar wichtiger sein als das Infrastrukturpaket. (Source: Bloom

all.headline: Lithium Producer SQM Sees Global Demand Growing 25% This Year
all.description: Top lithium producer SQM said it sees world demand for the battery metal growing about 25% this year, after reporting record quarterly sales volume as the industry emerges from a global glut.

all.headline: Pakistan, Afghanistan Threaten War in Region Eyed by Superpowers
all.description: Pakistan and Afghanistan edged closer to all-out war this week, escalating tensions in a region where the world’s economic superpowers are vying for influence.

all.headline: Trump orders government to stop using Anthropic in battle over AI use
all.description: The move announced on social media comes after a standoff between Anthropic's boss and the US Department of Defense.

all.headline: What the Warner Bros deal could mean for streaming, cinemas and news
all.description: If Paramount's takeover of Warner Bros goes ahead it could significantly reshape Hollywood.

all.headline: Government to give go-ahead for £1bn defence helicopter deal
all.description: The chancellor has stepped in to protect jobs at the helicopter manufacturer in Somerset, the BBC understands.

all.headline: Brewdog expected to announce sale early next week
all.description: Staff are told Brewdog's German arm is not included in the sale and will now be liquidated but bars will trade as normal this weekend.

all.headline: Paramount set for $111bn Warner Bros takeover after Netflix drops bid
all.description: Netflix's decision to back down from the bidding war clears the path for Paramount to win the takeover battle.

all.headline: Why you can't get a signal at festivals and sports matches
all.description: Connecting up music and sports events to the internet is a massive undertaking.

all.headline: Jack Dorsey's Block cuts thousands of jobs as it embraces AI
all.description: The Twitter co-founder says he believes the majority of firms will make similar changes "within the next year."

all.headline: Waitrose to suspend mackerel sales due to overfishing concerns
all.description: The supermarket chain says it will stop sourcing fresh, chilled and frozen mackerel by 29 April.

all.headline: Dyson settles forced labour suit in landmark UK case
all.description: Migrant workers alleged they were subjected to abusive treatment in a Malaysian factory for Dyson.

all.headline: Tyrrells plans to give vegetable crisps the chop
all.description: Parent company KP confirms the proposals may lead to the loss of a factory in Uttoxeter.

all.headline: What we know about the joint US-Israel attack on Iran
all.description: Iran has retaliated with a missile barrage towards Israel, while explosions have been heard in Qatar, Bahrain, Saudi Arabia, and the UAE.

all.headline: Bill Clinton asked about hot tub photo and testifies he knew 'nothing' of Epstein crimes
all.description: The former president told the committee that he would never have flown on Epstein's plane if he "had any inkling of what he was doing".

all.headline: At least 15 killed after military plane carrying banknotes crashes in Bolivia
all.description: Police fire tear gas to disperse crowds allegedly trying to take banknotes from the crash site.

all.headline: A 'delicate' balance for Canada and a 'win-win' for Modi as Carney visits India
all.description: The two countries are repairing a strained relationship as they also seek to reduce their trade reliance on the US.

all.headline: Aid groups in Gaza and West Bank thrown lifeline as Israel court pauses ban threat
all.description: Dozens of well-known groups faced shutdown under a new Israeli law, although the reprieve might be temporary.

all.headline: DOJ charges 30 more people in Minnesota anti-ICE church protest
all.description: Ex-CNN anchor Don Lemon was one of the original nine defendants arrested last month

all.headline: Tram derails in Milan, leaving two dead and dozens injured
all.description: The crowded tram was travelling in the centre of Milan at rush hour when it appeared to crash into the side of a building.

all.headline: Pakistan defence minister says country in 'open war' with Afghanistan after strikes
all.description: The latest attacks by Pakistan follow months of clashes between the two countries. despite agreeing to a fragile ceasefire in October.

all.headline: Why Trump means the Cuban Revolution faces its biggest threat yet
all.description: Will a worsening internal crisis create the conditions for the Cuban Revolution to unravel from within?

all.description: Follow the updates after the U.S. and Israel launched “major combat operations” against Iran early Saturday.

all.description: In dieser Wochenendausgabe spricht Rixa Fürsen mit dem ⁠stellvertretenden Chefredakteur der ZEIT, Holger Stark⁠, über sein neues Buch. Darin legt er dar, warum die USA sich zwar unter Trump verändert

all.headline: Trump says US conducted ‘major combat operations’ in Iran
US and Israel launch strikes against Iran
all.description: “We’re going to destroy their missiles and raze their missile industry to the ground,” Trump said in video confirming the attack.

all.headline: Far-right leader Bardella criticizes Macron’s pan-European nuclear push
all.description: "When it comes to nuclear power, I defend principles," the National Rally chief said.

all.headline: Trump says he’s unhappy with Iran negotiations
all.description: The president’s remarks come as the State Department urged personnel to leave the U.S. embassy in Israel.

all.headline: Italian opposition accuses Meloni of manipulating elections with new law
all.description: Critics of the proposed bill say it is designed to keep the ruling parties in power.

all.headline: Far-right AfD eyes court win as springboard for state elections in Germany
all.description: Alternative for Germany leaders are trying to use the court’s temporary ruling that they can't be classified as "extremist" to snag broader voter support.

all.headline: UK diplomatic staff withdrawn from Iran as US considers strike
all.description: The FCDO guidance follows American instructions to staff in Israel to depart due to "safety risks."
